final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures, consistent with the precision of current (1.50 A) and time (30.0 min) measurements.

method: First, convert time to seconds: t = 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t: Q = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons using n(e-) = Q / F: n(e-) = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu. Therefore n(Cu) = 0.02798 mol / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass using m = n × Ar: mass(Cu) = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
checks: Half-equation check: Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu confirms 2:1 ratio of electrons to copper atoms.
Mass calculation check: (1.50 × 1800 / 96500) / 2 × 63.55 = 0.889 g, consistent with 3 sig figs.
